title: U.S. Individual Income Tax Return
description: Standard individual income tax form used to report personal income, calculate taxes owed or refund due.

title: U.S. Corporation Income Tax Return
description: Form used by C corporations to report income, gains, losses, deductions, and credits, and to figure the income tax liability.

title: U.S. Return of Partnership Income
description: Form used by partnerships to report income, gains, losses, deductions, and credits.

title: Employer's Quarterly Federal Tax Return
description: Form used by employers to report income taxes, Social Security tax, or Medicare tax withheld from employee's paychecks and to pay the employer's portion of Social Security or Medicare tax.

title: Wage and Tax Statement
description: Form that reports an employee's annual wages and the amount of taxes withheld from their paycheck.

title: Application for Employer Identification Number
description: Form used to apply for an Employer Identification Number (EIN), which is required for most businesses.

title: Request for Taxpayer Identification Number and Certification
description: Form completed by contractors or vendors to provide their taxpayer identification number for reporting purposes.

title: Nonemployee Compensation
description: Form used to report payments of $600 or more to nonemployees such as independent contractors.

title: Miscellaneous Information
description: Form used to report various types of income such as rents, prizes, and awards.

title: Employer's Annual Federal Unemployment (FUTA) Tax Return
description: Form used to report annual federal unemployment taxes owed by employers.

title: Employer's Annual Federal Tax Return
description: Form used by small employers to report income taxes, Social Security, and Medicare taxes annually instead of quarterly.

title: Request for Transcript of Tax Return
description: Form used to request a transcript of previously filed tax returns.

title: Expenses for Business Use of Your Home
description: Form used to claim deductions for home office expenses.

title: Depreciation and Amortization
description: Form used to claim depreciation or amortization on business property.

title: Election by a Small Business Corporation
description: Form used by a business to elect S corporation status under the Internal Revenue Code.

title: Employee’s Withholding Certificate
description: Form completed by employees and submitted to employers to determine the amount of federal income tax to withhold from each paycheck.

title: Application for IRS Individual Taxpayer Identification Number
description: Application form used to request an ITIN (Individual Taxpayer Identification Number), for those ineligible for a Social Security number, or foreign nationls

title: Shareholder’s Share of Income, Deductions, Credits, etc.
description: Form provided to each shareholder in an S corporation that details their share of the corporation’s income, deductions, credits, and other items to report on their individual tax return.

title: Employer-Provided Health Insurance Offer and Coverage
description: Form used by applicable large employers to report health insurance coverage offered to employees under the Affordable Care Act (ACA).

title: Quarterly Federal Excise Tax Return
description: Form used to report and pay excise taxes on certain goods, services, and activities such as fuel, air transportation, and health-related services.

title: Determination of Worker Status for Purposes of Federal Employment Taxes and Income Tax Withholding
description: Form used to request a determination from the IRS about whether a worker is an employee or an independent contractor for federal tax purposes.

title: U.S. Income Tax Return for an S Corporation
description: Form used by S corporations to report income, deductions, and pass-through activity to shareholders.

title: Estimated Tax for Individuals
description: Form used by self-employed individuals and small business owners to calculate and pay quarterly estimated income taxes.

title: Net Income (Loss) Reconciliation for Corporations With Total Assets of $10 Million or More
description: Schedule used by certain corporations to provide a detailed reconciliation of financial accounting net income and taxable income, helping the IRS better understand book-tax differences.

title: Credits for Qualifying Children and Other Dependents
description: Schedule used to calculate and claim the Child Tax Credit, Additional Child Tax Credit, and Credit for Other Dependents.
use_cases: individual and small business owners with families

title: Self-Employment Tax
description: Schedule used to calculate the self-employment tax owed on net earnings from self-employment, which covers Social Security and Medicare taxes.
